summary_comment: Dr. Jesser is dedicated to her students, providing detailed feedback and passionate about her subject matter, though her lectures can be dry. Her courses require significant reading and writing, with a focus on group discussions rather than traditional lectures. While some students appreciate the challenging workload and meaningful assignments, others find the class demanding and the grading process unclear, with some perceiving her as passive-aggressive or overly critical.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Jesser is great. She really cares about her students and always makes the effort to provide detailed feedback. Lectures can feel dry, but she takes care to assign interesting and thought-provoking material. There might be more work than than in a typical GE course, but in my experience, you get out of this course what you put into it.

Dr. Jesser is a nice professor who's passionate about her work and is quick to respond to emails. She grades for content and idea development, not for your ability to write well which is appreciated. The course requires a very large amount of reading for a GE and quite a few 3-4 page papers, but class time consisted primarily of group discussions.

Classes is mainly group work. She talks a lot and its easy to get distracted. Shes kinda passive aggressive on the comments for assignments, and expects way to much for a shortened course. She also does not give out grades until the semester is over. Classes is heavy and its a lot of reading

Awful. This work load was unlike anything I could fathom a teacher would genuinely find reasonable. Once a week we had 2-3 page papers and we had 2 1800 word papers, 1 2600 word paper and a 40 minute presentation. On top of that, she doesn't give you your grades until the end of the semester. How messed up?????

I thought the class's content itself was pretty fun. I didn't like the way the discussions worked and felt it was forced when the content that was given to us was very straightforward in what it was trying to say. Most discussions felt dry and unengaging. There was a good bit of reading though she tells you what you're supposed to pick out of them.

Took her for Comp Studies 3645. Nancy is a bit dry and boring as a lecturer. Think she means well but just socially a bit awkward. Sometimes gets lost while lecturing or talks in weird circles. Papers are graded very easily. Try's to facilitate group discussion but she's so monotone in her talking no one wants to participate. Take for an easy A.

She cares about her work and class and is available for help. Sometimes it can be difficult to understand what she is meaning to say and the lectures can be a drag, but overall she teaches well and makes the topics intresting.

Makes literally everything more difficult than they need to be. Doesn't upload grades in an intuitive way (Carmen) so you're left wondering what your grade is for the entire semester. Takes "playing devil's advocate" to another level. It got to the point where she would just ask unnecessary questions. Unclear grading criteria. Avoid her if you can.

Nancys good at facilitating class discussions that make class engaging. Lots and lots of reading (if you actually do it...). Can get by by only reading the books you are writing your papers on tho. Did this and ended with an A. A good choice for a lit and global studies gen ed. I like easy classes and this wasnt too bad. Sometimes boring tho.

Dr. Jesser embodies the idea of "speaking a lot without saying anything at all." She routinely cut off students to interject with her own point, she would forget her own deadlines then be surprised when no one turned anything in and send the whole class a scathing email, and her grading schemes were awful. Avoid her if you can

I dreaded going to class every single day. Classes are boring and discussion-based, where she would play devil's advocate after every single point being made. She goes to the extreme in order to prove an irrational and irrelevant point. She is totally disorganized and the class does not have a set structure. Not a hard class but wouldn't take again

I really liked Dr. Jesser but I can see why other people found her boring. It took her a while to get comfortable with the class. She was good at pushing discussions further and making us question ourselves. With all of that said, I would not recommend her if you aren't genuinely interested in class material. She gives papers but grades easily.

She is very knowledgeable about the material and readings in class but very boring. She is a pretty easy grader on papers and group projects. Some of the material in class can be interesting but usually sitting through class is painfully boring, but you receive 2 points per class for attending and answering a question about the assigned reading.
Very nice teacher, a little bit boring. A lot of group project and 3 papers. Attendance is mandatory, she will pass an attendance sheet.

The class was not interesting for me at all. I read none of the readings. I simply attended every discussion and copied down the discussion points and regurgitated them on the 2 page papers due every week, receiving A's on every single one of them. I would recommend it as an easy A, but the discussions got old. Women are underprivileged. I get it.

The class was a fair grade.  Since the midterms are take home, as long as you are a good writer, you shouldn't get anything lower than an A-.  Make sure during the group presentation you choose a topic that will get the class talking.  Overall a fair class and pretty easy to get an A.

Dry reading, but if you talk in class and do the reading you'll get a decent grade. She's really nice and will look over drafts/give feedback on ideas. Not a particularly hard grader. Attendance points! If you can stick it out through some dry reading and you're not a horrible writer, take this class for a fair A.

Some of ya'll must be crazy or brain dead. I took Gender and Science with Dr. Jesser in Fall 2008 and class sessions were SO interesting that I was always disappointed when it was time to leave. YES, some of the reading material was dry, but it ALL pertained to important theoretical concepts! Jesser's class was the reason I pursued a WS minor!

She had a way of draining a subject dry...to the bone. When you thought there was nothing more possible to say about a topic she would find something. She purposely tried to take the opposite stance on a subject to "challenge" your thoughts. I understand what she was trying to do but it got old, quick. Nobody in my group ever wanted to talk to her.

Good teacher, smart and easy to talk to. Material she picked was BORING though. 3 papers, 1 group project and daily quizzes that you were guranteed 50% just for writing your name (seriously). The best advice for her class is definitely that you should pick the people you work with carefully, as you'll be working with them on everything all quarter.

like everyone on here said..very very boring class, but easy if you can make it through the lectures. pick your group wisely because you will work with them all quarter. 3 5 page papers and 1 group presentation. papers are easy. i got an a.
The class is based on group discussions.  There are 3 papers to write throughout the quarter, and a group presentation.  The subject matter was interesting and she is a very smart teacher.
completely unclear about what we needed to do for most of the quarter. very boring. she is smart, but she just isn't cut out for teaching.
Class is merely discussion only, 3 pt quizzes offered to track attendance. Not open to students opinions, not impressed with her attitude.
Super boring, reminds me of a bad high school teacher. But her class is a breeze if you have any common sense.
Lectures are boring but the class only consisted of two papers and an in class led discussion. Very easy if you pay attention.

Keep up with the readings, put some thought into the three short papers, and try to go to every class.  Lectures can be really long and boring, but the discussion is the meat of the course.  Also, there's a final project/paper.  Overall, decent class.
Easy, Just go to class and 3 papers. Not very clear on what was needed.
She's just another liberal more concerned with promoting her personal views than teaching the class.

summary_comment: Professor Suchland is highly regarded for her supportive and engaging teaching style, often checking in on students' well-being and encouraging their interest in the subject matter. However, the class is noted for its demanding workload, including extensive reading and challenging assignments, which some find overwhelming and poorly structured.

Ratings.comment: One of my favorite professors at the university! She never knew I was struggling with my mental health but always checked in on me when I wasn't participating. She encouraged me to complete my work and made the class one I looked forward to reading up on. I'm really interested in Russian culture and I'm glad I got to take this class :)
media provided to read or watch was always very confusing and hard to understand, plus oddly worded discussion boards and quizzes
Really chill and gives you opportunities to focus on what interests you. Very understanding if you are having issue with interesting lectures and not much homework.

Professor Suchland is really easy-going and nice. Her lectures are interesting and keep you engaged. The assignments are difficult, but she will work with you and give extensions if needed. The readings are long, however; she will tell you if you can just skim it. Overall, she's great and the class is really informative.

Great professor!  She is very well-informed and always knows what she is talking about.  Contents are super packed, thus, you will have to do a lot of reading outside of class.  And by a lot, I mean A LOT.  She is helpful and is glad to answer your questions.  Attendance and participations are required.

Cool lady, horrible class. Consists of an insane amount of reading every night, an impossible midterm, an irrelevant paper and a "creative" project that you supposedly have freedom to do whatever you want on, but she then criticizes you for not doing it in a way she would have preferred. So why doesn't she just make guidelines for it? Who knows.

nice teacher, bad assignments. your grade is made up of 4 papers a group project and participation. i HATED the group wiki project. very difficult and annoying. there is a TON of reading and towards the end the reading is pointless b/c you arent tested on it and there are no more papers to use it for. attendance mandatory. papers were confusing.

SEI.Subject: RUSSIAN
SEI.Class Name: Magnificence, Mayhem, and Mafia: Russian Culture

SEI.Subject: RUSSIAN
SEI.Class Name: Magnificence, Mayhem, and Mafia: Russian Culture

SEI.Subject: WGSST
SEI.Class Name: Global Human Trafficking: Realities and Representations

summary_comment: Lindsay is highly regarded as an exceptional educator, known for her deep knowledge of the subject matter and her ability to build strong connections with students, making the learning experience both enjoyable and effective. She is praised for her fairness, helpfulness, and willingness to assist students, fostering a supportive and engaging classroom environment. Students consistently recommend her class, noting its accessibility and the significant learning gains achieved.

Ratings.comment: Lindsay is so amazing! She is an incredible educator, really know her stuff. The best part about her as a professor is she makes a true relation/connection with her students, and very caring. Grading is great, and she has really taught me a lot. Assignments are pretty easy, and discussions in class are really interesting and educating.

I had this teacher for comparative studies just this last Autmun quarter and she was excellent. She is extremely helpful and laid back. She seems more like a fellow student who is really willing to help you rather than a strict professor. I learned a ton in her class and became a better writer as well. TAKE THIS CLASS IF YOU HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY!

Professor Bernhagen is one of the sweetest lecturers. Totally articulate, really fair grader, and always ready to help students with their grades. She's also a cutie with a killer figure, but that's just the icing on top of her academic greatness.

Lindsay is an awesome teacher. She is so nice, so fun, and very informative. I very much recommend her because going to her class and having a discussion is very similar to sitting around chatting with friends. She's great!

Very easy to do well in her class if you do the readings. You can email her at any time with questions or paper drafts and she will give you feedback. Keep an open mind and you will learn alot in this class.
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor M is highly regarded for her engaging and supportive teaching style, though some students find her lectures and class format somewhat traditional. She emphasizes regular attendance, offering substantial points for participation and providing helpful feedback on assignments. Students appreciate her approachable nature and the enjoyable content, including films and discussions, although some find her class structure and attendance policies strict.

Ratings.comment: I was kinda surprised to see such high reviews. She seems like a nice person, but her class was very dull and taught just by lectures. Kind of felt like a high school class. And attendance was way too strict - you have 2 absences allowed for any reason, including being sick, if you miss any more your grade drops from an A to an A- or A- to B+, etc.

Very friendly and easy to talk to, assignments and exams weren't too difficult. However, DO NOT MISS CLASS. She will take lots of points off for missed classes since a large portion of the grade is participation-based. Show up to class regularly and participate and you'll be fine.

take the first year seminar with her! super caring professor who makes you think about love in different ways, very clear grading, and weekly readings, two movies, and a group project. very interesting and easy class taught by someone who is super sweet.

Mandatory attendance which is annoying, but if you pay attention in the lectures and watch the movies you can get an easy A. Offers to review your papers before submission which is a big plus. Definitely cares about student's success.
Easy as long as you attend lectures. She gives you 2 tries on the quizzes. I loved the films she picked they were all great. Overall a good Professor and an interesting class.

I've taken three classes with Prof. M. and loved them all. She picks fun films to watch and the readings are helpful rather than boring. Her lectures are concise and facilitated discussions are always interesting and engaging. She's a professor that makes you want to participate and her exams, a midterm and a final, are easy if you take notes.

I can't say enough good things about Dr. M and this class. Highly recommend for anyone considering a service learning class. Had a fair amount of readings, but only met once a week instead of 2 because of our SL. Dr. M is incredibly sweet and a great professor, I hope I can take another class with her!

She was such a great professor! I loved this class so much. Sometimes we had a decent amount of reading, but everything we read was really informative and helpful. Her quizzes and papers were very reasonable. Prof M is really funny and made every class worth going to. If I get the chance to take another one of her classes, I will!
A lot of reading and watching movies but all worth it
Dr. Mizejewski is hilarious, kind, interesting and wonderful. Her class is amazing and engaging and fun. TAKE IT.

Loved this course! She is a great lecturer, very interesting and funny. Shows a lot of films in class. Easy quizzes/2 tests, attendance, and two short papers make up your overall grade. One reading quiz and one movie quiz are dropped. Just come to class, skim the readings, and watch the movies and you will not only get an A but have fun doing it.

This class is an easy A and yet you still learn a lot. Movie quizzes are v easy if you watched it, reading quizzes you're given a study guide with the potential questions. Midterms and exams also have a guide.

Lots of quizzes but as long as you actually watch the movie/skim the material they're easy. She shows lots of film clips in class which I appreciate. She has a lot of energy and even in a larger class she still knew all of our names.

She's lively and brings excitement to the classroom. Movie quizzes are super easy, as long as you actually watch the film. Reading quizzes are relatively simple (provides a study guide). Readings hardly show up on exams. Provides a study guide for midterm and final. Must attend class (allowed 2 absences before half a letter grade is taken away).
I loved this class. You learn a surprising amount for the topic, bottom line is she's amazing and you'll pass if you try a little bit.

Quizzes were very straightforward a easy if you readwatched the film. Tests are easy because she gives you a study guide. As long as you study that, you'll do fine. She's very sweet and enthusiastic. Never not smiling. I took this just for my visual arts credit but ended up learning way more than I anticipated. She's a wonderful prof.
This class was wonderful, as was Mizejewski. She is very passionate about the subject and does all she can to help you understand. She is very thorough. Plus her energy is fantastic.
Amazing professor! The class was really interesting and the material was manageable. Take it!

I took Women, Hollywood and Film in Fall 2011, and I enjoyed it very much! She was a great lecturer, even though I'm sure lecturing in the gateway with all her students' faces barely visible in the weird lighting must have been weird. Very helpful, very nice, and I always recommend this class to whoever is open minded :)

Excellent professor, had her for Hollywood, Women and Film. Not only did she give detailed analysis of scenes in class, she also pointed out what she would be testing and even *gasp* eliminated a problem on a test because too many people had gotten it wrong. Be sure to show up for class, you won't regret it!
I had her for Women in Film Noir, she's definitely one of the best profs in the WS department.  She's super-nice and really dedicated to teaching, her class is a lot of fun.

Professor Mizejewski is so excited about teaching, and her energy level in the class could make anyone interested in the topics she lectures on. I took her film class about women in film, and it was interesting and it challenged my thinking.
I love this class! You don't really need to read for class, but you definitely have to for the quizzes and tests. She made the class really interesting and easy to understand. I LOVED this class.

This class is easy. She give you everything you need to know in her powerpoints. She only allows two absenses and it helps to go to class and listen. There's one paper and every other class is a film. She discusses what's important. Take it you won't regret it...

Dr. M is such a great professor. She really knows what she's talking about. She's really enthusiastic and makes it easy to stay engaged throughout the whole class. Class is not hard at all if you show up. I would definitely take another class with her and recommend this one to anyone.
She is extremely knowledgeable and enthusiastic.

Dr. M, as you could call her, is extremely well-organized,highly knowledgeable, and integrated technology rather well into her pedagogy. She encourages students to run their drafts by her and offers very helpful comments in the process. Her choice of films for WS527 struck a fine balance between breadth & depth. "Gender and Horror" was enjoyable!

Great lecturer.  Very excited about her topic.  She's one of those knows too much for her own good professors, but it comes across well in class.  I actually learned alot from this class.  You would think that women in horror film would be generic and basic at best, but mizejewski made it fun.

summary_comment: Professor Melissa Wiser is perceived as strict and demanding, with some students praising her for acknowledging hard work and valuing class participation, while others find her classes boring, irrelevant, and poorly graded. Her teaching style and expectations vary widely among students, with some appreciating her high standards and others finding her approach frustrating and unengaging.

Ratings.comment: She thinks that her class is the only thing going on in all of her students lives. The way that she interacts with people is rude and borderline insulting. If you don't show up to one of her classes expect an extremely rude and disgusted look. The classes are boring and there is no correlation to the course work with any of the lectures.

Melissa Wiser was my favorite professor I've had at OSU. If you put in the effort to speak in class and go up to her after to ask for feedback, she will acknowledge your hard work. As long as you do your work and actually participate in class, you will do well in her classes!
Strict, assigned seating, can't use word “interesting” in papers. Boring classes.
Terrible. Does not care about student and does not give anyone good grades. Get ready to read a crap ton and ONLY talk about what was in the readings for entire classes.

It is clear she cares about her students, however extremely dull and most irrelevant information for this major. She also is a slow grader that will leave you to guess what grade you have just days before finals and graduation.

Dr. Wiser is a gem if you put in even an ounce of effort into her classes. As long as you respect the class and consult the readings beforehand, you will be perfectly fine. There are so many things that you can learn from this course (and Dr. Wiser) that are truly valuable beyond the classroom if you just take a moment to listen to her insight.

The content is not relevant to the class. There are things such as which fork is needed in fine dining and the class is about internships in sports. Takes forever to grade even though its an asynchronous class with minimal work. The modules are all copy and pasted with old information. She gives no effort and her questions are poorly worded. AVOID

I'm not sure why everyone doesn't like Prof. Wiser. She was honestly great. Yes tough, but put in the work and show up to class and you'll be great. She expects hard work and likes class participation (she will probably like you more if you participate). I would like to have her again, and she told me at the end of the semester I did a great job!
Dr. Wiser's online class was well organized, and I understood her grading criteria. The content was all relatable and useful for the class even though it sometimes felt tedious.

Don't take this class if you don't have to. Lectures are very vague and if you have questions, don't expect clear or any answers (especially to emails). The final is a ton of work and makes you want to rip out all your hair. She has the expectation that everyone wants to pursue research after graduating.

Participation and being in class is so important, especially since she is the only professor I know that makes you turn in hard copies and on carmen. She genuinely cares about teaching so I would say if you take any class take this. Good discussion, just keep up on the readings or at least skim them.

She is the worst professor Ive ever had. She expects way too much, and thinks her class is the most important. I learned nothing from the class, because I was so focused on turning in all the assignments. She is a very tough grader, and takes months to grade things. Would avoid at all costs.
Horrendously tough grader. I wish this class wasn't mandatory for my major or they'd get a new professor to teach it.

I had Dr. Wiser for three classes during my undergrad and as much as they were a pain at times, I actually had to try. You can sleep walk through a lot of classes and still get a decent grade but not with her. Yes, she was tough and yes, she expects more out of you for an A in the class. Unless you're lazy, unmotivated or both, she is respectful.

How she is employed at a major university is mind blowing. The cashiers at McDonalds have better communication & people skills than her. Wouldn't doubt that they have a higher IQ than her too. Keep politics out of the classroom and stop crying that your candidate lost because you act like a kid crying at the grocery store for not getting candy

Dr. Wiser is a tough professor but if you try hard enough and actually have some care for what she's teaching then her classes are incredibly valuable and engaging. You don't have to buy -in to everything she says, but if you make the effort to engage and participate with the material regardless she will be more amenable.

Dr. Wiser is above the rest, she is very passionate about the class and she throughly cares for the subject. Even though her classes aren't a walk in the park, if you participate and engage in lectures then you can be one of her favorite students. Take advantage of learning from her.

Her treatment of a class that is ludicrous and patronizing at its core is absolutely revolting. The class outlines how to act in the professional realm which in itself is a useless lesson as all students taking the class have successfully landed a job. She treats the class as if it is nuclear physics and grades way too tough. Avoid at all costs
She is the worst. Seriously, the worst.

She is absolutely terrible. You can't ask her a question without her making you feel dumb. She doesn't explain much detail on her lectures and just overall is brutal. I wish I could have taken 20 classes this semester over her 1. She is not friendly and is rude. AVOID AT ALL COST, I repeat, AVOID AT ALL COST. This is here Sports Research class 4900

Honestly, one of the worst teachers I have ever had. The class should be an online class and the material that she teaches barely has anything to do with what she tests you over. Would not take this class again if you paid me! Absolutely terrible!

This class is typically an 8am and should be online. The things we do in class are things that don't even relate to the sport industry. If you need to know how to eat in an interview and are super eager to answer every question in class take this course. If you just need it for your major, like most of us, take it online in the summer.
Very power hungry. Takes the class much more serious than it needs to be. I would not recommend her to anyone. Feminist.

Too much irrelevant work for a class that is supposed to basically expose you to the sport industry field as a career, not job hunting. Much better would be online with focus on your field experience observations, not resumes and pronouns. Hard grader.  If you are in any way not totally feminist or supportive, whatever you do, don't talk about it

This MANDATORY IN-PERSON class should be online. It is completely unnecessary. I don't even know what else to say but be prepared to have to sit for over an hour one week, learning about pronouns and adjectives.. and no, that is not a typo. Also on the list, resume week, dinner etiquette, cover letters, how to dress for a interview, etc. Have fun!
Too much. Unnecessarily, too much. That is all.

Very intriguing class with interesting topics and discussions.  Melissa is incredibly knowledgeable about the subjects she teaches and easily captures the student's attention.  Overall the class is easy as long as you do the weekly readings and take thorough notes.  I highly recommend taking it!

summary_comment: Professor Ballah is highly regarded for her passion and knowledge in teaching African history, making her classes engaging and discussion-based. Students appreciate her availability as an academic advisor and her focus on understanding over grades. While some find her classes demanding and note-taking crucial, her clear communication and caring approach are widely praised.

Ratings.comment: Professor Ballah was a great resource and she cares about all her students. There were a few short papers and a decent amount of reading in the class I took with her, but they were all manageable and clearly outlined in the syllabus before class began. I really enjoyed my time in this class and recommend it for history and non-history majors alike.

HIST 175 @ W&L: Insane breath of content taught well. Readings aren't bad. There are "pop-quizzes," but you can guess when they'll be. You do need to prepare; they aren't easy. Overall, she care more about understand the material than grades, so you'll get an a or a-. Prepare for three miserable papers. Speak up in class. Not life changing.

HIST-175 @ W&L. Prof. Ballah is one of my favorite professors ever. Classes are discussion-based and questions are encouraged. She knows damn near anything you could ever ask her about Africa's History. You will succeed if you are intellectually curious and take good notes. Also my academic advisor, and she gives the best advice. A blessing.

Professor Ballah is the best. Although she tends to ramble, her stories and her personal connection to her teachings is where she is the most brilliant. You get what you put into her classes. I absolutely recommend !

Com'n, you guys just demand too much. When a class is too demanding, you got frustrated; when it's too easy and flexible, you got more complaints... She's really excellent. No surprise or tricky questions in exams. And she cares her students a lot. A big thumb up! - Solid Aer

At first I thought she would be a really great teacher...but it didn't turn out that way. She rambles pointless stories about herself and christianity. If you are not catholic or christian I imagine you would have been uncomfortable in the class. Insulted the entire class in saying we didnt know how to write thesis statments. Didn't like her.
She wasnt very helpful- rambles on about herself majority of the class. Very tough grader for a GEC class...You have to go to class or she'll call you out.

Mrs. Ballah is an EXCEPTIONAL instructor.  The university is better for her being her.  I found her to be extremely knowledgeable and passionate about the material, and goes out of her way to make sure you understand it.  I would strongly recommend Mrs. Ballah to everyone.  She keeps the class interesting and entertaining as well.

It was a boring class I ever had. A lot of un neccessary talking in the class which s irrilevant to the subject matter. Boring text and reading articles posted on carmen. I have got nothing out of this class but just the A- FOR WHICH i DON`T KNOW nOTHING.
Great TA, best I've ever had.  Willing to help you out if you have a health or family emergency.  She's a lot of fun in class.
I liked that class and ms. ballah alot.  she was fair and made it really easy to talk about sensitive topics.  don't be mad cuz you got a bad grade :-P

Ballah blows. She's crazy. She flips out in class, looks you in the eye while you are talking, and then two seconds later doesn't remember that you were just talking. Doesn't care about students, is an idiot. However, super easy class if you show up and turn everything in.

Most of your grade is based on 3 papers and attendance/participation.  I honestly did not learn much from this prof.  There was a lot of reading and lectures were pretty boring sometimes.  I expected a lot more out of this class, but it was decent.
She is very knowledgeable about women's health subjects. But there are too many topics in this course. It's about quanity not quality. However the the instructor's alright.

summary_comment: Dr. Kuzawa is highly recommended by many students who find her caring and willing to help, despite the demanding workload. However, others warn of her condescending attitude, unclear instructions, and harsh grading, suggesting a mixed experience with significant variability in student perceptions.

Ratings.comment: I would highly recommend Dr. Kuzawa to anyone looking to take this class. While the class requires a lot of homework and effort, Dr K is incredibly caring and willing to help when necessary. If you are willing to put in the effort and engage in class you will be fine. I think the other reviews are incredibly harsh and not at all true. I loved her.

Honestly I was scared going into this class because of the reviews, but they couldn't have been more wrong. Dr. Kuzawa is extremely intelligent and truly cares about each student and each project, doing research for us outside class. She gives a lot of homework but that is expected with a 4 credit course. I'd seriously recommend her.

She treats a class that is a required gen-ed for engineering students like it's the most important graduate level course in the university. She doesn't grade super hard but is a stickler for citations and will actually read the sources you cite and give you lip if you don't interpret  sources right. She also gives way too many assignments.
This professor gives lot of homework and always talks about her grad students. Tries to run the Gen Ed class like a graduate level English class.

AVOID THIS CLASS. Kuzawa is condescending, often has a bad attitude, and acts as if she's better than everyone else. Homework/lectures are often long, redundant, and disorganized. Grades are harsh even though she doesn't give good instructions. Save yourself.
Some instructions are not that clear but she's easy on the grading.

my advisor suggested this class for me, which why I took it. This professor is probably the most condescending person I have ever met. Often is very moody and yells at students when they ask questions they should already know the answer. jumps to conclusions. high expectations and hardly ever gives anything higher than a B+. Avoid if u can.
Rude. Fake nice. Vague instructions and lectures are required but useless. Course organized horribly.

She assigned much homework that we had to write at least three papers every week. She often changed the due time so that we have to spend a really long time to write the paper crazily. Moreover, she was a tough grader. what she said in class was boring and complicated that most people wanted to live. I suggest that none of you take this bad course

ENGR 2367 suppose to be an easy GE but not the case for this teacher. We have in total 50 assignments a semester and she is a tough grader. Her instructions for homework are also very unclear and she always changes the due date which is also very annoying.

Doesn't realize this is a gen ed that engineers have to take. Not only does she actively try not to give A's, the course load of this class is more than my actual major classes. Her class is boring and uninformative with most information already known. Prepare to have 4 assignments due in one week with little explanation. Worst class ever taken.

Her lecture is totally useless, but the attendance is required. There are tons of assignments. If you wanna get A for seconding writing class, avoid her. Also She always gives low grades. Literally, She should go to a community college.

This class taught me real life things I should know, but the amount of work in this class is seriously over dramatic. Every class there multiple things due that are very pointless. Also, theres no explanation of anything. This class made my anxiety highten so much. Now, my anxiety is worse than before and carries into my non-school life. Good luck

If you are willing to do the assignments you'll be fine. She is a harsher grade but in the sense that she doesn't give A's. If you get a B+ on all big assignments and A on the smaller ones you'll land with an A.

Almost everything that was said, is true. Very unorganized, not very clear with instructions, way too much work, not enough time for the work. However, it isn't impossible to get full credit for an assignment. So if you have the enduration to do 50+ assignments in a semester, then it will be an easy A, but I recommend that you avoid her.
This class was supposed to be an easy gen ed and she made it way too hard. So much work with not enough time or enough explanation. I would highly recommend taking this with someone else.
You want to avoid her class. While all the other classes had an easy time, Ms Kuzawa lectures forever while you should get time to work in class. She is a tough grader also
Terrible I would say. Never clear on da assignments and when stuff is due. Very condescending. VERY HARSH GRADER

I found Deborah to be a good teacher. She obviously cares about teaching and knows her stuff. Some of the stuff we talked about wasn't new to me, but the examples she provided were really helpful. I liked all the interaction with my classmates and with Deborah. People saying she is condescending is at odds wit my experience. She was always helpful.

I felt like I was wasting half a tank of gas every time I drove to campus for this course. She is incredibly condescending and doesn't seem to know what she's talking about. She didn't really teach anything, just gave a ton of examples and talked about them. Thought we were going to learn how to write, not formats for business letters and resumes.

Took it last year and have actually used some of the stuff I learned in the class for my other classes.  I liked that she was accessible, and that we actually spent time learning  how to write better instead of just reading a bunch of stories.

Deborah is my favorite English teacher that I have ever had. I would love to take her classes over and over again. She's very helpful and interested in teaching. I hated all my writing classes except her class. She grades fairly and she's an easy grader.

I took English 110.03 with Deborah during Winter. As a international student, I thought she was very helpful with my English writing. I met with her often and she helped alot. She cares about teaching and her students. Sometimes she talked way to fast though.
I am surprised by the negative comments here! Deborah was a helpful and dedicated instructor, although she does have a dry/sarcastic sense of humor.
Terrible teacher. Condescending and doesn't really have an idea what she's talking about. Didn't know a single person in my class that liked her, but still got an A.
Very inefficient teacher. Disinterested, condescending and unfortunately took a composition class for me and made me less enthused about my own personal writing abilities.
Very intelligent teacher, did not receive much from the class. Seemed like she was too "by the book" rather than being innovative or interactive.

Pretty good teacher, grades fair.  She gives you the opportunity to re-write your papers if you didn't do too well.  Don't take this class if you don't like to read.  Pretty interesting stuff, and this is coming from a guy

Can be aggressive at times, and is a critical grader.  Knows her material well- and expects you to know it just as well.  Not bad if you keep up with the reading and plan to re-write your papers a few times.  Don't not take this class because of her- she is fair.

I love English and I love women's studies, but this teacher is ridiculous. Some of the material is good, but her grading of papers is harsh. She claims to grade nicely on the final, so here's hoping. Avoid at all costs.

summary_comment: Professor Sierra Austin is highly regarded for her engaging and supportive teaching style, particularly in her online courses. Students appreciate her responsiveness, passion for the subject matter, and willingness to help students understand course content and meet deadlines. Her classes are described as interesting, stress-free, and enjoyable, with a focus on discussion and opinion rather than strict grading on facts.

Ratings.comment: A: the class was really interesting. B: this professor was very caring and took the time to respond with thoughtful comments on multiple assignments of mine even thought it was an online course. She seems very excited to engage with students and hear their thoughts. Even though I was unable to attend, she also invited students to meet once.

Sierra was fantastic. I appreciate that she doesn't grade on facts, she mostly asks for out opinion. This class had weekly modules consisting of a show or a few readings, and occasionally a Google Form with questions about the reading, or more often a discussion post about our thoughts. This was my easiest class all semester and was stress-free.

I really liked Professor Austin. The course material was super interesting and while the class formatting was a little hard to get used to at first (no lectures, a lot of independent work) I think it was overall a great course. It is really easy to get a good grade if you just participate. I feel like I learned a lot and had fun doing it.

This professor is one of my favorites. I am taking my fourth class with her and every time she has been great. She is very pleasant and will work with deadlines. If you don't understand some thing just ask and she will explain clearly of what she is looking for. Her assignments were fun yet challenging. She is very warm and cares about her student

This class reworked my feminism for the better. She is passionate and willing to talk outside of the course even though it's online. If you do the work and comprehend it, easy A and she works w/ you on deadlines. First few weeks are reading heavy so you have a good fundamental grasp of the issues, but past week 4 or 5 the work load wayy gets easier

Sierra Austin is a PhD candidate whose online Black Women Writers class couldnt have been more irritating. Long story short, dont enroll in one of her online classes. She: provides no feedback as to what is an adequate analysis; isnt a consistent or standardized grader; is kinda petty; and literally doesn't teach. You get links to read & thats it

summary_comment: Dr. Burack is highly knowledgeable and encourages open discussion in her classes, focusing on weekly readings and one-page papers. Students appreciate the manageable workload and relevant material, though some found the class to veer more towards history and politics than expected, leading to disappointment. Overall, opinions vary, with some students loving her teaching style and others finding the grading criteria unclear and the content not meeting their expectations.

Ratings.comment: Expected to read a number of pieces, but they are all interesting and manageable. The only assignments are weekly discussion posts, which are graded pretty fairly. Attendance isn't mandatory, but I enjoyed going to class. Burack is extremely knowledgable and really just wanted to have open discussion (not mandatory) with the class!

Dr. Burack provided very relevant material to read. This was the first time that I actually read every. single. book. for a literature class and loved them all. There are about 6 papers that are one page each (double spaced) and a weekly discussion post--not too much work. Truly enjoyed the material and loved both her teaching and the class.

Her grading is specific and feedback equally so. All the papers were exactly one page long (with the exception of the journal due at the end of the semester). The lectures go with the flow and are quite laidback.

Expected a lot more from a writing class than nitpicking grammar or points off without meaningful feedback as to why. Had high expectations, but ended up often disappointed as lectures went off-track and the class became more history/polisci than lesbian literature. I really wanted to like this class, but I just couldn't. Would not take again.

Read a WLW book list instead. It could have just been the online format but neither this class nor Prof. Burack were great. Online lecture slides were lackluster + time spent in class wasn't spent teaching us but rather making us ask questions, then giving non-answers or personal anecdotes. Grading was fairly tough and expectations were unclear.

She grades based on 6 papers only and does not provide adequate feedback for these papers. She also never provides a rubric for these papers and expects you to just be good at writing. She only draws on her own experience as a lesbian and does not actually share knowledge with the class, she only discusses history from her point of view. Awful.

One of my favorite professors! Extremely smart and an expert in her field. No exams but does use group/class discussions in class. Lectures are not pre-prepared and instead flow with the conversation. Pushes students to think differently. Reading due each week with one-page responses. Also graded on quizzes and in-class work. Only met once a week.

I felt like the exams were super easy, I can only remember missing one or two questions on each. Shes pretty straightforward about exam prep, but if you dont literally take notes during lecture, youre not going to do very well in the class. Felt like I deserved an A, but the grading criteria was not clear at all! Did not use Carmen at all!
Really great professor, incredibly knowledgeable and interested in her subject. I could listen to this woman talk about paint drying.

Six papers, but the max length for each one was 2 pages double spaced, and each had a different format (like one was a chart) so it was surprisingly easy for a writing II course, but she is a very tough grader! We read six books but they were all good, and overall the workload was very light. She is definitely cynical but has good things to say!

I really did not like Prof. Burack. Her lectures were incredibly boring, and although it was supposed to be a discussion-based class, she rarely let students get a word in. Her discussion questions were boring and not thought-provoking. Everything was graded very vaguely and she literally had no grades in Carmen, ever.
Awesome class. The reading assigned is really good. I am a male and never felt Professor Burack discriminating towards me. Professor Burack is the best professor Ive had at Ohio State!

Prof Burack is refreshingly down to earth and gives great anecdotes. She can be cynical but I would definitely like to hear to lecture about anything just for her specific view point on certain topics.

Cynthia was a professor I actually enjoyed listening to. Class was always interesting and I learned something new everyday. My TA was an easy grader and the Midterms and Finals were no-brainers at all. I aced bothed. Definitely the easiest and most interesting class to take!

She's very knowledgeable and helpful. However, I've never received less than an A on papers prior to her class, but in this class I never received anything higher than a B. She is a stickler for writing rules that are completely asinine. But the class is really fun, especially when the class gets involved.
great professor!

I am a female and I took this class with my friend who is a male. We both wrote the papers together and did excessive amounts of reading. I got B+'s on my papers and he got C+'s consistently. He is a much better writer than me and its unfair how biased she is. Don't take the class unless your a girl who is good at sucking up.

Dr. Burack is one of the best professors I've had the privilege of learning from. She is an extremely articulate speaker and more than willing to go the extra mile to ensure that you understand the material. The class was one of my more difficult ones for the term, but if you put in the work required it really pays off. Would recommend to everyone!

I had professor Burack for WOM STDS 367 and WOM STDs 110, 110 was very interesting and well organized. 367 covered material very quickly. Professor Burack often runs off on tangents and looses track of where she was in lectures. TAKE NOTES! slides are not available online and ALL information on her slides are helpful for the tests.

Great professor. Clearly excited about the material. Fair to all students, both in opinion and grading.   As a writing course, she didn't cover the art of composition in much detail, but she more than makes up for it in explaining and backing the reading material.  I would definitely take her again - despite what a previous post says - I'm a gu

Prof. Burack is very clear -everything was repeated to the point where taking notes became a formality; tests are easy.  However, she was my least favorite teacher at OSU.  She was incredibly rude to all of the boys in our class and not at all friendly with the rest of us.  I would not repeat this class with her, despite my interest in the subject.

Horrible professor.  Always wanders off topic, is horribly biased against men, and refuses to back the points she makes in class outside of it.  She is incredibly condescending, but easy.  If you want a guaranteed A, it's a great class, and if you want a radically one-sided view of women's studies, take it, but otherwise STAY AWAY.
Hands down the best professor I have ever had. Extremely intelligent and highly engaging. Cannot wait to take another of her classes.  Great lectures and fair grader.
Very good professor. Study guides before tests were very helpful. I learned a lot in this class.
No Comments

Comes off a little bit intimidating in the beginning, but as the quarter went on I found myself liking her more and more. Lectures were organized and interesting, and study guides before the finals made the class so much better. Highly recomended!
She's great. No ifs, ands, or buts.

She is, hands down, the best professor I had in the women's studies department.  I learned so much in her class not only because if I hadn't, I could've failed, but because she inspired me to.  I ended up with one of the most satisfying "A's" in

burack is the reason i decided to minor in women's studies.  she is straightforward and informative, but never dull.  she does have a great voice, and provides a great performance overall, and is in everyway the kind of professor i aspire to be.

Dr Burack is one of those professors who is really smart and expects her students to keep up with her.  If you do the reading and work hard, it will be one of the most rewarding classes you will ever take.  If you don't, drop the class now.

Her classes are tough and definitely *not* an easy A, but you get a lot out of it if you keep up.  Also, she's very willing to stay after class for a bit to talk theory or clear up a topic, but she's pretty inflexible in requirements for her class.

I received an A- on the midterm, but I still dont' really like her. She gives off a vibe like she's totally unapproachable, and she's not very clear about what she's going to test you on. She also got rude w/ me when I told her I had to leave early once.

Class was a small seminar, so students talked mostly.  Always very interesting, engaging, and friendly. Also, she has a beautiful, soothing voice that you just want to close your eyes and listen to.  She should get a radio job. :)
No Comments
She is one of the best teachers I have ever had. You just need to be a little bit smart in order to keep up with her. She knows her stuff and I was priviledged to have her as a professor!!!!! A++++++

She was one, if not the worst teacher that I have ever had.  I dropped the class solely because she was so utterly unhelpful.  She tells you flat out that she is not there to help you!!! Stay far far away from this prof.

summary_comment: Professor Victoria Genetin is highly regarded for her engaging and thought-provoking teaching style, particularly in courses like Women and Addiction. Students appreciate her passion for the subject matter, her non-judgmental approach, and her detailed, constructive feedback. Her classes are described as interesting, fun, and supportive, with many students recommending them and expressing a desire to take more courses with her.

Ratings.comment: I took an online section of Women and Addiction. The course is really thought-provoking and interesting. It is quite a bit of reading and you have to be self-disciplined since it is online. She gives good detailed feedback on all of your responses, though. I don't feel like I know her very well, but I know what she thinks about my writing.

One of the best instructors I have had at Ohio State. I encourage everyone to take this course. Ms. Genetin is passionate about course materials and the learning environment in her class. She is non judgemental and very intelligent. You will learn a great deal from this professor. Honestly enjoyed going to class.

She is a great teacher, very open minded and easy to talk to. The class was really interesting and was a lot of fun. I really enjoyed using blogs instead of writing formal papers. Definitely take another class from her again.

This was a GREAT class! I know exactly who the student below is that rated Ms Genetin poorly & she is lying! Ms Genetin gives everyone a chance to talk and uses a uniformed 10 point rubric where she gives detailed feedback. The student complaining below was obnoxious in class & pretty much annoyed everyone. Ms. G. had lots of paitence w/ her.

Great class. Interesting readings, and pretty easy assignments. Easy to get an A if you pace yourself, and Victoria is a caring instructor who is incredibly helpful. She takes feedback seriously and works to make class a comfortable, nonjudgemental learning environment.

summary_comment: The professor is widely regarded as ineffective, particularly for introductory courses, where students find the material overly advanced and the syllabus confusing. Reviews highlight issues with unclear communication, lack of clear guidelines and rubrics, and inconsistent grading practices. While some students appreciated her approachable nature and interesting material, the overall consensus is negative due to significant teaching and administrative shortcomings.

Ratings.comment: Honestly, it is a intro class and she makes it seem like you are in a 4000 class. Don't take this class.

Anindita was extremely unclear and not helpful at all. Her English is pretty good but the way she words her questions makes them very difficult to answer. If you're into a class that has a constantly changing syllabus, no rubrics for the papers, and opinionated answers to questions then this class is for you.

I loved her class...She was easy to relate to and nice. The assignments and quizzes were all really easy and the material was very interesting. She was pretty bad with computers, but everything else was great.

Terrible. She had no clear guidelines/ rubrics for assignments and then took off points for things she never told us to do.  She didnt have half of our assignments graded til the day of the final and then gave the entire class the exact same grade for one assignment. Students taught the class and she never responded to a single e-mail I sent her.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her passion and enthusiasm in teaching women's studies, which keeps students engaged and inspired. However, students consistently report issues with organization, including delayed grade returns and disorganized assignments, which can be frustrating. Despite these challenges, many find her lectures enjoyable and her passion contagious.

Ratings.comment: Unprofessional. Extremely opinionated so don't bring your own ideas to class because she will tell you that you are wrong. But overall, super easy.

She's an amazing teacher who's fun to listen to and easy to learn from. She inspired me to learn more about women's studies. She is the worst grader I have ever had. I'm writing this review on the last day of the semester and ZERO grades have been posted!

I really, really like her as a person.  As a teacher, our class was so disorganized.   The lack of structure in assignments made it difficult to really know what was expected.  The grading of assignments also took forever.

She's an awesome, fun and hilarious teacher and brings a lot of passion into the subject of women's studies that kept the class engaged. On the other hand, she's pretty disorganized and can't seem to get a grade back to you for the life of her.

Took a disrespectfully long time to return grades to students. Has had our assignments for weeks now, and still doesn't have grades in when they're due today. VERY small class of only 38, too. Hate to see how long her grading would take with a class any larger. She's cool, but this is very aggravating. Hopefully she's better for future students.

Interesting course, and she is very passionate about teaching it, but she was frequently promised grades returned in a timely fashion, but then would not bring them to class, or have them graded yet. Insultingly long time for grade return to students for things they worked hard on, and got done in a short time frame for her, which kinda sucks.
She was awesome! Although she showed up late to class and was often unprepared, you could tell how much she cared about what she was teaching.
She was a great teacher. She is very passionate and knows what she is talking about. After taking this class I became more interested in Women's studies.

She is very passionate about what she is teaching, which makes it a great learning experience when it comes to class discussion. If you do all the work, and communicate with her, you will get a good grade in the course. Only downside is that she is pretty bad about grading assignments and returning them on time, so if this is big for you, beware.

MacRorie was an awesome instructor! She definitely knew what she was talking about and cares a lot about her students and the things she teaches. Assignments are fun, engaging, and fairly easy. I definitely recommend taking this class!
Definitely knows what she is talking about as far as class information. Easy to talk to, easy to get along with.
Helpful and nice. Class itself was a bit boring.

summary_comment: Dr. Rossie is highly regarded for her enthusiastic and engaging teaching style, particularly in Girlhood Studies at TCNJ. Students appreciate her open-minded approach, extensive knowledge, and ability to foster a respectful and inclusive classroom environment. However, her classes are known for being demanding, with heavy reading assignments and rigorous grading standards.

Ratings.comment: I also had Dr. Rossie for Girlhood Studies at TCNJ and she really sparked my love for the topic. She gives heavy readings due by each class that'll supplement your discussion, but for the most part these readings are very enjoyable. Rossie is absolutely kick-ass and has so much enthusiasm in what she does!

I had her from Girlhood studies at TCNJ. Dr. Rossie is the bomb, she is so engaging and very well spoken. The class is discussion based so you have to participate but that's half the fun of the class. Dr. Rossie knows how to have good discussions and she always incorporated clips or documentaries to make class more interesting. I'd take her again!
Very energetic in class. Enjoys what she does. Can easily be reached after class.

She was nice to me but didnt like others. Didn't teach; just read off slides. Assigned TOO much readings. Went to Georgia before the final, but didnt accommodate (had to turn in the final the friday before the weekend we were supposed to have) nor give us any notice. Couldn't control the class. Class was mandatory which was annoying & was curved.

She is an absolutely wonderful professor. Not only is she SUPER open-minded and creates a safe and open space for discussion, she is adorable and incredibly knowledgeable in her field. Even if you come in to the class with a lot of Women's Studies knowledge, you will leave it having learned SO MUCH from her.

She's genuinely interested in both the coursework and her students. She adapted the syllabus to the class's liking and she's adamant about creating a respectful atmosphere. That being said, she is not an easy A, but do the work and you'll be fine. One of the best teachers I have ever had.

If your looking for a easy class keep looking. You will have to do alot of reading. She is not the easiest grader in the world. No extra credit. Must be there every day!!! She nice but I will not be taking her class again.

For a writing class, reading 5 novels is a lot. Plus a total 8 papers. A pretty harsh grader..to get an A is a 95% (CRAZY). Don't take if you aren't interested in feminism you will want to die. She's incredibly nice and sweet! A good teacher. The class is a lot of work though for a gec

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for their compassionate and helpful nature, described as an "amazing person overall and a great professor." They are also praised as an excellent instructor, deeply passionate about the subject matter, which enhances the learning experience and results in significant knowledge gain and enjoyment among students.

Ratings.comment: Compassionate and helpful. Amazing person overall and a great prof.
Great instructor! Lauren is very passionate about the subject & it shows in her teaching. I learned a great deal and enjoyed attending class every day!

SEI.Subject: ARTSSCI
SEI.Class Name: Arts and Sciences Survey: Social and Behavioral Sciences BA/BS

summary_comment: Professor Smooth is highly knowledgeable and passionate about Women's Gender Studies, but her teaching style is largely ineffective, leading to confusion and disorganization among students. Lectures tend to be lengthy and often veer off-topic, and she can come across as authoritarian, making disagreement difficult. Despite some positive aspects noted by a few students, the overall experience is marked by poor communication and a lack of engagement, resulting in a generally negative perception of the class.

Ratings.comment: Professor Smooth is extremely disorganized. While it is evident that she is knowledgeable and enthusiastic about course content, she does not communicate clearly with students. She made this course very confusing.

I took this class because I needed it for a GE and it was all that was open, had I known more about it I would have just taken less credits. Professor Smooth had her way or the high way, if you disagreed with her opinion then you were wrong. Her lectures were long and had nothing to do with what we were actually learning.

Dr. Smooth was a great lecturer and is really passionate about Women's Gender Studies but oftentimes she would just lecture off tangent on things that we (the class) weren't sure of the relevance to the test. If you are passionate about Women's Studies this class will be easy but attendance is mandatory and the TAs are tough paper graders.
Dr. Smooth is awesome! She is such a positive beginning to my mornings and her lectures are great! The TAs on the other hand...

While Smooth is a huge part of Ohio States WGGS program and is super intelligent, lectures stink. I can only recall a handful of times she wrote on the board. The readings are so extensive but you have to read them to actually understand lecture. brownie points: print the material and highlight she loves that! material is great; she ruins the fun

She's very unprepared and the whole class is just her lecturing and talking about all the reading you have to do somehow. Her expectations are wildly too high. She never responds to emails. She takes this class too seriously. I would NEVER recommend anyone take this class. While the material is interesting, she ruins it.

women studies 110 isn't an easy A but it's def very possible. Smooth was pretty good, but I loved my TA, Jackie. She made the class so much more interesting because of discussion during recitation. I didn't expect to fall in love with this class but I did, it's one of those classes that have the potential to impact you for the rest of your life

THIS CLASS WAS SOOOOOOOOO BORING TO ME! She seem happy to teach us but we never really got through anything because spent WAY too much time talking on and on and on and on and on about one topic. I did not learn nothing from this class. Also her "helpers" was NOT very "helpful" at ALLLLL. Overall I would not recommend any one to take this class!!!
Too much work for a 100 level class! You have to write 5 papers, go to outside events, and tons of reading! However, the class material is pretty interesting and eye-opening.
I loved this class. I looked forward to it everyday I had it. Although you don't get lots of one on one time with Dr. Smooth she has such a passion that it is very enjoyable.

Dr. Smooth  really made me think. She is not easy, there's a lot of reading, but it is worth it. She made me think about so many things. I took the class last year and I am still thinking about it. She really made me get it that women's progress is ongoing and only gets better if we actually THINK about changing it. This class rocked!

The lectures were very interesting and always well prepared.She tried to have everyone participate in class! Too bad she never talk about the reading in class. The TA makes the class. I had a bad one, Meghan Kough who only cared about applying for her PhD program. The TA makes the meat out of the class, all the fun debates! Overall, good class!

Very enthusiastic and passionate. I found the mandatory attendance annoying. But overall lessons were okay. 5 writing assignments a must. Midterms & Finals were not comprehensive. Always go for the pre-exam review sessions. Good class if you are interested in Women Studies or Gender studies.

Easy class...lots of work for a 110 course, though.  Dr. Smooth is pretty funny and has entertaining lectures, she also enjoys pop quizzes. A ton of reading and 5 mandatory papers. Good class, so long as you have an interest in womens studies
Lectures were very long and did not always stay on point.It helps to have a good TA because I found that my notes from lecture weren't all that helpful on the midterm.

I had a horrible experience in this class. It was uncomfortable to speak in class and there was too much work for a 100 level class. She ignored any emails sent to her and so was not helpful at all. She also passed out an "Etiquette Sheet" saying we were not welcome to visit her in her office, and that we shouldn't ask questions about the tests.

Dr. Smooth is an excellent and very professional instructor.  She knows her material very well. She backs up her statements with facts and interesting anecdotes.  She requires you to work hard, but it certainly pays.  This class brought out the best in me, writing skills, ability to analyse and she is extremely well organised.  Not for slackers!

Not worth it to take as a 100 level teacher.  Enthusiastic about material, not in making work load appropriate for a 100 level class.  Too much outside reading required, mandatory attendance in lecture and recitation, 5 papers plus final and midterm.  Material v. interesting, it just took way too much work to get an A.

I agree with the other poster. This class was not enjoyable.  There were three books, the readings were long and boring. Lecture was the same - long, boring and mandatory.  Detailed questions about readings on tests. Going into the final we only knew 30% of our grade... which was the overly difficult mid-term. I would not recommend this Class.

While it was obvious Dr. Smooth enjoyed what she was teaching and encouraged debates, she was the most unhelpful professor when it came to outside of the classroom.  I tried to contact her numerous times and she totally ignored me, along with her TA Stacia Kock.  She talked the ENTIRE class and the readings took forever! DONT TAKE HER CLASS!

SEI.Subject: WGSST
SEI.Class Name: Black Women:  Representations, Politics, and Power

summary_comment: The professor is highly experienced and known for her engaging anecdotes, making the course material interesting through various texts and films. However, her teaching style is largely lecture-based with minimal student interaction, and she presents her opinions as facts without encouraging critical thinking or discussion. Students find her condescending and disrespectful, and there is a lack of transparency regarding grades, as she does not use Carmen and does not post grades online.

Ratings.comment: Believes her opinions are fact, is disrespectful towards students, and does not care for you at all. Does not use Carmen and doesn't post grades so you don't know what your grade is ever. She is rude and lectures as if you are not respectable or educted. Disrespects your perspective. No class discussion on anything and does not tolerate feedback.

She presents her opinions as fact so be prepared to regurgitate what she says and it will be an easy A.  No grades are posted online so you only have a vague idea of where your final grade comes from.  I had been excited for the class, but she made me feel like I was being lectured by a condescending parent.  Not enough room for class discussion.

Although she's brimming with life experience it's literally all she talks about. Her assigned readings also tend to be too dense for a single class period to your cover and her notes are terrible and often contradicting.

extremely experienced in the field. great lecturer, lots of awesome anecdotes. more radical than most professors i've had. i highly recommend her. problems included lack of student discussion and seemingly disinterested in talking after class. most ag students openly disliked her for some reason.

Spends majority of course lecturing. Not a lot of student discussion, which is nice if you don't like to speak in class. Great anecdotes that enrich the concepts used. Papers are very easy... some good texts/films used.
The course material was very interesting - the readings and videos, especially. Classes tended to drag on, though.
made an interesting class very uninteresting.  horrible lecturer.
I think that the reason this class sucks is because the instrutor is not very nice. She is condscending and bitter.

I hated this class.  I don't know if it was the teaching style or not, but I dreaded it every day I had it.  I know it's a requirement, so my suggestion is to make the best of it.  It was pretty informative, a lot of reading and writing.  Easy A though.

summary_comment: The professor was generally accessible only through discussion posts, making the course easy to pass with minimal effort, though she provided little feedback. Some students found the class incredibly easy and praised the engaging topics and clear passion from the instructor, while others highlighted issues with module accessibility and delayed email responses. Overall, opinions varied widely, with some students finding it one of the best classes they had taken, while others considered it their least favorite due to communication difficulties.

Ratings.comment: This professor was not accessible, many times modules were not unlocked and email were not answered. Luckily the course is made up of discussion post mainly. Its an easy A if you like doing post. Doesnt give feedback either but hey what do you expect you read the top sentence. Easy course, you teach yourself mainly

Incredibly easy class. Gabbard doesn't unlock modules on time or answer emails quickly, but the assignments are incredibly easy. There's no textbook, she provides all readings, but sometimes you have to watch things on Netflix, YouTube, Hulu, etc. Would definitely take as an easy GE. Easy to get an A!

Honestly my least favorite professor I've had in my entire college career. In an online class, she refuses to give you a syllabus that is accessible unless you're online to view it. When you contact her, she does not respond if an email is not up to her standards (without no example) and in an online class email is the only form of communication.

She was amazing!! I learned so much from her class. The movies we watched were fun (Mean Girls, Easy A, etc.) and we would have discussions over them and the articles we had to read. There was a bit of work for this class and there are movie quizzes, but pretty much as long as you showed you were putting in effort, you would get an A.

Best class I've taken at OSU so far! Sonnet is so passionate about the course and truly cares about her students. She makes lecture interesting and engaging. There limited outside graded work, but quite a bit of reading. It's so easy to participate in class because she covers super cool relevant topics. I (almost) wished the semester wouldn't end!

LOVED this course with Sonnet. One of the best professors I have had. I enjoyed all topics discussed. This course helped me learn how to use proper terminology in relation to gender studies, which helped me tremendously in my profession.

Sonnet was a good professor and very sweet. She was bubbly and passionate which made it easy to learn. She is a little strict with attendance though but if you show up and participate you should do pretty well. A lot of our grades were from weekly online posts in a forum.

Very interesting class and great teacher. She's a very fair teacher overall. She does require attendance and doing the readings. She has pop quizzes based off of the readings but if you do them you will be fine. I would definitely recommend her!

Class can be rushed a times, needs to slow down and not cram so many activities in a single class session BUT one of the best classes and teachers I've had. HIGHLY recommend her. She will challenge you, engage your desire to learn and work with you every step of the way. Excellent, excellent instructor. Take her class, you won't regret it.

You are pretty much guaranteed an A if you show up and do the readings. Repeat - she is a stickler for attendance and encourages a ton of participation but the assignments are easy... she really just wants you to learn and participate and be engaged so grades aren't the most important thing. Great teacher, she'll like you if you come every day.

Flawless approach to teaching- best I've had in 4 years of college. She works through extremely hard readings with you and forces you to grow a lot as a human being but its relatively low stress otherwise. Super adorable and supportive and approachable.

She is amazing. Probably the best teacher I have ever had in college. But you need to go to class and do the readings. She makes the class so that as long as you do the work and come to class you will do well. Definitely take her if you have the chance.

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for her engaging lectures and interactive discussions, though some students find her grading criteria strict and her expectations for participation high. Her classes are generally well-organized, with clear lectures and comprehensive materials provided, making it easier to prepare for exams. However, some students note that she can be tough on those who are unprepared or unsure about course material.

Ratings.comment: I handed in all my work passed all my assignments but couldn't do my final the day of bc my computer crashed and I was giving a C- with my average grade being 283 and her criteria grade was 310.. So confused
Amazing class. Very interesting. Have to do readings and study for tests, but she gives you everything you need to know. Unfortunately I was in the minority Fall 06 but I Loved loved loved it.
Class in interesting, however she does shun you down if you don't know the answers, so be prepared.  Midterms are more than you would expect from a women's studies course.

Great class. Raili is a great lecturer and discussions/lectures are great. Does a great job of bringing concepts together. Smaller classroom so make sure you participate in discussions (do your readings)
If you want a great Women's Studies Class with a teacher that'll teach you something she is the lady. Go to class and do the reading you will be completely ready for anything she throws your way.

Guys if you are going to take a Women's Studies class take it with this woman. You are not going to get beat down daily for being male. Raili makes the class quite interesting and interactive, make sure to show up to lecture and you will have no surprises. Do the reading it's important!
No Comments

really easy class.  Organized lecture and notes.  There shouldn't be any surprises on the test but she took off for spelling on essay tests (which is crazy considering her english isn't always very clear.)
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Womack is highly regarded for her supportive and caring approach, providing timely feedback and creating a conducive environment for learning and discussion. Students appreciate her dedication to their success and find her classes insightful and engaging. However, some students have noted issues with unclear grading criteria and tough paper grading standards, which detracted from their overall experience.

Ratings.comment: I highly reccomend Professor Womack, she has went above and beyond to provide me with timely feedback I can use to successfully and confidently complete major writting assignments. She is very caring and supports students goals in learning.

This professor is very smart and really prioritizes the student before anything else. It would be really hard to fail this class if you showed up and participated. Don't fret over some of the harder readings! Just do your best and come with questions then you won't leave confused. Overall, love the teaching style of this professor!
This class was a great expansion on a lot of gender studies concepts and Prof. Womack is a great resource on these topics!
lots of class discussions, but she makes it very conducive to participation as well as an easy and fun experience!
Really insightful and aspirational.

You can tell she really cares about her students and wants them to succeed in the class and get something out of the material. Make sure to watch the weekly videos and follow the prompts for assignments and you shouldn't have any problems. She's also super responsive to email and will give feedback or guidance if you have questions!

I did not like this professor. She never used Canvas/Carmen for grades so you never know what your grade is for the class. She grades tough on papers, if you don't have a full page typed she will deduct points. Assignments were very vague and not all of them were on the syllabus. I enjoyed the class material, just not the professor.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for his insightful and organized teaching style, which creates an engaging and supportive learning environment. Students appreciate his clear communication, high standards, and personalized feedback, noting that his classes are both challenging and enjoyable. His dedication to helping students succeed is evident in his efforts to foster a positive community and improve their skills through interesting and relevant material.

Ratings.comment: Really kind, insightful, and organized. Also really funny! I never found myself checking the clock during his class.

He's very organized and clear, but also supportive. And he made the most supportive class environment that I've ever been in. He learned all our names the first day, and helped us all learn each other's names. It was really a good community environment for learning.

I learned something new in every class, and the readings always felt interesting/relevant. He has high expectations for essays, but also gives clear expectations and helpful feedback. In office hours, he really helped me improve my final essay. He also creates a really positive environment for class discussions.

Would take again. Sometimes the workload got heavy, if we had a film + a long article due together. But everything we watched/read was interesting, and sometimes really funny! Professor Branfman also gives clear expectations and feedback for essays. He also brings lots of energy to every class, and you can tell he cares about everyone's success.
Great class, great professor.
