He's heading to Stanford next, and Cornell will miss him.

His first-year writing seminar was great! I thought I already wrote well before getting here, but he helped us all get much better at researching, outlining, writing, and proofreading. He has high standards, but he also really helps you meet them: he gives clear expectations and personalized feedback. Would take again!

Always looked forward to his class, and I'm trying to get a spot in his spring class. He's clear, funny, and fair, and the class topics always connect to real life. He has high expectations, but he makes a supportive environment for learning how to meet those expectations. If you take his class, you'll laugh a lot and learn a lot.

He is not a great teacher. The class is discussion based, so you come to class just to talk about questions he poses. You have to speak at least 3 times which is frustrating because theres not always lots to say if you dont want to be repetitive (he will call u out for both). Directions are unclear and he waits till end of term to post grades..

Branfman is an incredibly captivating speaker and lecturer and is always very kind, open, and eager to help his students. His assignments were rather interesting and fun to do. He's funny, his enthusiasm is contagious, and whatever he has to say is guaranteed to be insightful.
Absolutely incredible professor. Gives great and informational lectures. Grades fairly and quickly. I learned an incredible amount from him and anyone would be lucky to take a class with him.

Took this class as a gen ed and didn't know much about women studies. Jon did an AMAZING job. I recommend him and this class to all my friends. He always sets clear expectations and returns grade SO fast. Fair amount of reading but it was interesting and I didn't mind. If you do reading and pay attention, tests/ papers are easy to ace.

I recommend this prof to all my friends. Took his class for a GE and didn't expect much--but had an amazing time! I learned a ton that will really stick with me and applies to my everyday life. So glad I stumbled into this class and this prof. Jon was the best. Quick & fair grader, really engaging/fun teacher, and challenged us in the best way.

Very helpful and approachable, always happy to answer questions. Very well-organized (I mean the semester plan overall, the assignments, the layout of each class, everything). Always totally clear what's expected from students and why we're doing what we're doing.

Excellent! Super genuine, creates a great positive classroom atmosphere, makes everyone feel valued when they participate. Passionate, smart, interesting, & knowledgable. Really great at respectfully challenging you to think critically about everything.

Everything you could want: Passionate, energized, fast(!) grader,  totally clear explanations even on tough concepts, keeps your attention with funny lectures while still teaching you a ton. Plus Jon cares SO much about his students: If you seem down in class, or miss class, he'll always ask if you're okay.  You definitely have to read and show up.

summary_comment: This professor is widely regarded as one of the toughest instructors, known for her demanding workload and strict grading criteria. Students consistently report that her classes are significantly more challenging than expected, often requiring extensive time and effort to succeed. Reviews are overwhelmingly negative, with many advising against taking her classes unless one is prepared for a significant challenge.

Ratings.comment: This was the worst class I have ever taken, I took it during the summer and it was 3 hour credit class, the work felt like I was taking a 5 hour credit class. She doesn't even follow MLA format, it seems like it is something she just made up. DO NOT TAKE!!!!
Dude all I can say is, mistake of your life if you take this class. No one liked the class for a reason, you see the ratings. Dont do it to urself. Trust

im an A/B student and i took one of her classes before this that wasnt hard at all. however, this class was THE hardest class i think i have ever taken for a class that is only filling a GE for me. if i couldve picked ANY other class, I WOULDVE. do not recommend her at. all. i received a C+ in her class, and how i even managed that i have no idea.

Im sick of hearing dont drop this class everyone can do it shes by far one of the hardest and worst instructors Ive ever had. Shes very hard. If youre looking for hard work for a class that could be very simple, take her. I believe shes been doing this this for too long and needs to be done. She does the worst in explaining assignments.
Absolutely loved this class and professor! Definitely take her class, you won't regret it!!

I wish I would have researched this professor prior to taking her online class. I am an A student and this will be my first C ever. She does not explain things clearly, and even when you follower her ruberic, she will still tax you heavily "grade wise" if you are not specific enough to her standards. PLEASE AVOID HER AT ALL COST. VERY BAISED.

Very difficult online class. Lin is a very tough grader and there are a lot of tests with super specific questions. There is a lot of work and a lot of readings every week. If you want an easy A dont take this class. You have to put in a lot of time and effort to pass.

Lin Distel is a professor who makes you work for your grade. You will not pass if you dont review her syllabus and evaluative criteria. This is a session 1 online class and its very fast-paced. You have to read the assigned readings. You can get an A but you have to work for it, its too hard for a 1000 level GE.
Honestly stay away from at least her online classes very unclear on the instructions and frankly not a very good class to take online.

I first liked this teacher...then one day after class she got in my face and yelled at me telling me i was disrespectful for talking in her class and that i was not aloud to sit next to my friend anymore..the funny thing is i never even said a word to my friend during the class period..all i did was laugh at something that was funny.

This teacher is absolutely amazing!  One of my favorites!  She keeps discussion interesting and listens to everyone's opinions.  Readings are easy and interesting because they apply to things that affect our daily lives.  I would definitely recommend taking this class for an easy grade that you actually enjoyed!

Best instruction I've had at OSU. very discussion based, very intellectually stimulating. Hard exams but very fair. Must participate in discussion for good grade. Loved going to her class. Brilliant woman.
Professor Distel is great. TAKE THIS CLASS.  Class is 100% discussion so be prepared to talk or it will seriously affect your grade. LOVED IT!

summary_comment: The professor conducts a highly discussion-based class with lenient grading on quizzes and projects, allowing up to three absences without penalty. However, students find it challenging to participate effectively due to infrequent reading assignments, and some complain about the professor picking favorites and being overly strict with grading.

Ratings.comment: The class is very discussion based. There aren't many reading quizzes, but there are randomly some. It's difficult to participate in the discussion if you haven't read. She is a very easy grader on quizzes and projects. We had a couple of extra credit opportunities this semester. She allows you to be absent 3 times before being docked.
how can english majors get A's in their english classes, but not even get near that in a ws writing class? picks favorites, ridiculous grader.

summary_comment: This professor is generally well-regarded for her engaging and sweet demeanor, effective teaching methods, and clear communication in English. However, opinions vary: some find her classes easy and enjoyable, while others criticize her for excessive reading requirements and lack of substantive discussion, deeming her class unengaging and a waste of time.

Ratings.comment: A lot of readings, but if you read most of them then you'll be fine. She loves what she teaches and it shows. Have respectful discussions and listen to others and the class will be really easy.
she's very sweet and nice. speaks fantastic english. teaches the material well. told great stories. all around good professor

Dong is a sweet person, but a terrible teacher.  You have to read 6 books, but you never get to discuss any of them; it's a total waste of time.  The class is super easy, but it's so boring that you'll never want to go to class (and it's required).  Absolutely the worst class I have taken at OSU.
Not a hard teacher at all. If you are not WS major or never taken one before she would be good for you. Not very exciting though if you already know your stuff.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods and ability to facilitate thoughtful discussions on controversial topics. Students find her classes both engaging and respectful, with many noting her ease in guiding difficult conversations while ensuring all viewpoints are considered. Her approachable nature and clear study guides contribute to a positive learning experience.

Ratings.comment: I still remember this professor and class sometimes. I learned about gender and it made me think.
she's an easy teacher if you read all the readings and participate in class. very interesting class!!!!!!
Sara is awesome

She was a great teacher...some of the issues we discussed were very controversial, and I thought she did an awesome job of making sure that everyone's views were respected. The class was very interesting!
Very easy class.  Assignments are easy and she gives study guides for the exams.  Great GEC.
Awesome
No Comments

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for their engaging and enjoyable teaching style, characterized by a mix of humor and interesting content that makes the class exceptionally appealing.

Ratings.comment: Very nice professor! Humor and fun! Very interesting content in the class. Loved it!

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for making the English class engaging and enjoyable, with a focus on interactive group work and interesting discussions. Students appreciate his understanding and caring nature, especially during stressful times. While the course involves significant reading, particularly challenging at times, the exams are relatively easy, and the overall experience is described as entertaining and fun.

Ratings.comment: Very interesting person(in a good way). Helpful and caring. Actually makes English class somewhat fun and hobby quickly. I love the interaction the group work in class it enable students to practice what is learnt under supervision and consolidates the knowledge

His class was interesting in its own right, and he did a good job of picking and presenting the material. Lots of interesting class discussions. He was also one of the most understanding professors I've had, especially after the violent incident mid-semester. He seemed really stressed out all the time but he really seems to care about his students.

Great professor, super easy course and absolutely hilarious. Cares about "participation," but that means attend class and answer a question every few days. Incredibly easy tests, as subjects and questions are very broad and easy to apply. Reading most nights, but it is usually short articles online.  Very interesting course, and Shaw is a great guy

Brendan always kept the class entertaining; probably my favorite lecturer thus far! you will have to read a lot and some of them can be challenging to understand the first time through but he does an amazing job helping you decipher them! The tests a really easy and the papers we not bad at all!
Tons of readings that were clearly written for a much more advanced audience. Definitely not an intro class, and not what you'd expect after reading the course description.

Brendan is AWESOME the readings are pretty tough and a lot of theory to understand but the midterm and final are a piece of cake. You can tell he's passionate about what he teaches, such a fun class! More like hanging out with friends!

LOVE Brendan! (He goes by Brendan, not John.) Always makes class entertaining, overall just funny nice guy. Knows the subject and clearly loves it, chooses decent movies for the class. Readings suck but you aren't tested on them so they aren't a big deal. Go to class!! Definitely recommend this class with Brendan.
Brendan is HILARIOUS! he keeps the class really interesting and is very helpful in answering any questions you have. You watch great movies too! HIGHLY RECOMMEND this class

summary_comment: The professor is perceived as inconsistent among students; some find her helpful and effective, particularly in encouraging class participation and providing support for writing and presentations, while others describe her class as repetitive and biased, leading to disappointment and minimal learning. Overall, opinions vary widely, with some students finding the class easy and enjoyable, while others regret their choice due to the repetitive nature and the professor's strong ideological stance.

Ratings.comment: Awful.
Pretty easy class. Nice prof.

I was really excited to be taking Gender Womens Studies but after taking it I regret it. The class isn't hard. Just show up but in class you repeat and talk about the same things every single day. She is a hard core feminist and if you don't agree with her then she will give you a strange look. I didn't learn much.

She is very helpful, and she teaches very well. her class participation is very essential. you have 3 papers(she grades tough on ) and 2 presenattions(easy).. dont get scared, because she is still very helpful, im not a strong writer but with her help she has taught me a lot and made me better. she likes you to talk professional in papers.

Skylar is a really good teacher.  She creates an atmosphere that makes her students comfortable and want to talk in class.  She's a fair grader and attendance isn't required, but it is strongly recommended.  READ THE BOOKS.  Only 3 papers and 2 presentations, but they're not bad.  Highly recommended this class and this teacher.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her impactful teaching, particularly in transforming students' perspectives on feminist issues through comprehensive and thought-provoking material. While her classes involve substantial reading, students find the content valuable and engaging. Her dedication and willingness to assist students are consistently praised, making her both an effective instructor and a supportive presence in the classroom.

Ratings.comment: This class completely changed my perspectives on the feminist movement, and made me SO much more aware of the problems that racial, class, gender, etc. biases can present for women. Readings sometimes took a while, but were well-worth it. Assignments were easy, as long as you read the learning objectives for each unit!!!
Great experience in my first womens gender class. Very prompt and specific for all class details.

Andrea is an amazing instructor. She helps students when necessary but allows them to think for themselves. Class is a safe space where you can freely talk about sex and sexuality. Lots of reading, but interesting material. Highly recommended course and instructor.
She loves what she does and what she teaches, and she's smoking hot. So you'll want to go to class.
Loves what she does and is always willing to help. Lot of reading and writing assignments, but none are too challenging. Love to have her again.

summary_comment: The professor is highly organized and effective in explaining course material, leading to student success; however, some students note that she grades on the harsh side, particularly for writing assignments. Overall, she provides valuable learning experiences and is recommended by many students.

Ratings.comment: I took her in an online class. She was very organized and explained what she wanted well. I got an A. It wasn't an easy A, I worked hard, but I did feel like I actually learned a lot when I just took this class for GE credit. I would recommend her.
Brena is a fantastic, well organized and informed professor. She does tend to grade a little harshly, but let's be real: this is a 2nd level writing course.
She taught a good class with interesting readings. But she graded too hard on the writing and could only read printed writing.

summary_comment: Professor Livingston is highly regarded for her rigorous approach to teaching, emphasizing deep analysis and argumentative writing over mere summary. However, her classes are also criticized for being unstructured and disorganized, with some students finding them confusing and frustrating due to her lack of preparedness and inconsistent communication. Overall, while some find her challenging and rewarding, others warn of significant organizational issues and unreliable grading practices.

Ratings.comment: Prof Livingston is a very wise person. some say that her class is hard simply because she requires that we take the readings seriously and learn how to interpret and write about the passages in a argumentative way, instead of simply writing summaries of the readings. You will learn a lot from her, trust me.

I understood that her expectations of the students were to think beyond the material spoken in class and make your own conclusions. I think many of us are not push to think beyond a set box frame and that could possible make it difficult class for some individuals. I am proud of the learning experience I gained from the class.

This is the worst professor I have ever had. Her lectures are completely unguided ramblings about her politics. Her tests are easy, but only if you copy word for word her answer, which isn't always correct. She actually did not show up for our final exam and have not received a final grade for the course 2 months later. Avoid at all costs.

Oh man. This woman is for sure the worst teacher that I have ever had. She doesn't use notes or slides, she just sits at the front of the room and talks. Her answers are the only right answers. She didn't give a rubric for an 8-10 page paper. Please believe me when i suggest that you do not ever ever ever take her class! Seriously don't do it.

Don't take this class. She doesn't follow the syllabus, and no one knew what book we were supposed to be reading at any given time. She shows up late to class, doesn' come, or does come then says class is canceled. My final grade will be a huge surprise because I have only received one grade so far and there's  1 more week in the semester. AVOID.

Probably the worst professor/teacher I've had so far in my life. Very unorganized and didn't have a structure. She sometimes would go off topic and ramble. The tests ask a lot of ambiguous questions that could really effect your grade. I wish I would of avoided her class.

She has a weird laugh and can be very disorganized when it comes to telling you what's required for papers & exams. The trick to pass her class and do very well in the class is GO to her office hours. She will definitely explain what she is looking for in more simple details. Please go to office hours

Don't even go there! If she's your teacher just drop the class while you can. I still haven't recieved a grade, school ended a week ago, her final was 2 weeks ago. She's disorganized, gives the wrong readers, says she'll do things but never does. It was a bad experience.

Horrible teacher!!! One of the worst I've ever had. NO office hours ever. No syllabus up-to-date for our class. NEVER answered any emails I sent. NO CLARITY at all in direction she wants for papers and offers NO useful feedback at all. TRUE- GRADES ON A WHIM! AVOID at all costs!!! I didn't listen to these reviews and I truly suffered. Save yourself

She was the worst professor I have had at OSU. She never answered emails, would not show up to class without telling us, and obviously didn't want to teach. She grades arbitrarily and penalizes you for independent thinking. Avoid this professor.

Avoid her. Easy class yes, but she grades on a whim even if you write an A paper she'll give you a B and offer no good reason for it. Horrible at clarity for papers and seems full of her own opinion. Disorganized all the time and didn't even show up to our final, we had to go give her our papers personally since she didn't trust the internet.

Awful at answering questions, shows very little interest in student input. Extremely disorganized, puts next to nothing on carmen, does not follow syllabus, & you will not know when things are due unless you go to class because that is the only time she will tell you. She will briefly mention it at the end of class...if you don't hear, you're sol.

I felt like I learned absolutely nothing from this class.  If you tried to voice an opinion or discuss a topic she did not want to discuss, she would gloss over it and give it no consideration.  She was constantly late to class, disorganized and generally not very knowledgeable.  The reading choices were good but quite frankly, wasted on her.

She is by far the worst teacher I have ever had. She is never prepared for class, so rambles about useless topics and she gives the worst essay prompts. She grades ridiculously and is really just a horrible teacher. AVOID HER!!!!
She is a wholly bith

Horrible teacher! All you do is read books and then she rambles about the books. Receive vague prompts for papers and do not get much guidance. She is very opinionated about topics, lazy teacher, and does not seem to prepare much for class. Also, have a vague syllabus without a distinct timeline. I would recommend not taking a class with her!
she sucks

This is the WORST prof I have had during my time at OSU.I have taken many courses and been very happy with every professor in the department. However, this woman offers no feedback, is lazy, unorganized, and really unhelpful. DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE WITH LIVINGSTON!
Hands down, worst prof I've ever had!  She does nothing to try to help students and you get no grades/feedback until week 8.

Prof Livingston is a good story teller but she is rather disorganized and vague. No grades were given at all in the class we weren't even given the chance to dicuss or grades before she sent them to the registrar. She graded things according to the way she felt and really didn't have a grading rubric. I avoid her classes. never again.

very disorganized, she missed class with no notice  when papers were due ..leaving students confused.  she forgot to post one of our righting assignments so she droped it...she didnt seem to prepare anything for class she just seemd to ramble
She is a wonderful storyteller; great at reading aloud. The class was easy. Somehow, I got a B despite bombing the  only (I think...) test and turning in two papers extremely late.

Worst professor EVER!The syllabus means nothing to her.Requirements for writing papers were not discussed until AFTER the papers were due.Her grading is arbitrary and random, plus no grades until week 9.I have no respect for her as a professor.

Her classes are mostly just discussions among students.  Was fairly easy going with papers (she extended due dates on several) Loves an independent thinker, and throw in some feminism (it's a women's studies class for pete's sake!)

She didnt seem very interested in teaching. Spent most of the class talking about things not relevant and never had papers graded on time. I took the class last quarter and only knew the grade of one of my 4 papers!
I had a very very easy time in this course. Just do the readings and "by the book" essays and you will sail to an A.
No Comments

Very good prof.  Papers are tough, and you MUST do the readings.  She has a few pop quizzes so you have to be on top of your reading and notes. I enjoyed knowing that any good grades that I got were well deserved.

I really like Prof. Livingston because she knows what she's talking about, and she makes you think during discussions. I would warn anyone considering taking her class, however, that there's no b.s.-ing her papers. She's very strict about what she wants.

Very interesting class, I learned a lot.  She makes you think for yourself, but she's really tough on your papers..she likes them very structured.  Most challenging writing class I ever took -- went to office hours often, and the writing center weekly!!

summary_comment: Professor Collingwood is known for her demanding and time-intensive classes, requiring significant effort and multiple assignments per week. Her teaching style is described as biased, making it challenging to perform well without aligning with her views, though some students find her lectures interesting. The class structure, particularly the reliance on technology, varies among students' experiences, with some finding it overwhelming while others appreciate the challenge.

Ratings.comment: This class was hard for a GEC. Lots of work each week. Lots of readings, quizzes, papers, etc. Very little time to do so. This class requires a lot of time and effort. Harder than my nursing courses. Have to attend virtual online classroom, which we didn't know before we signed up for the class, or you have to write two papers a week.

Interesting material, biased teaching.  You basically have two options to do well. 1)  Agree with EVERY word she says (or at least keep your mouth shut if you don't).  2) Work your butt off to make up for your opposing position.  I chose the latter and got an A, but it was miserable.  Also, don't count on her grading papers in a timely manner.

I had Prof. Collinwood for Eng 592, which was Women's Science Fiction. Although the lectures were interesting and she obviously had done her research, her instructions were vague, the reading schedule was chaotic, and her writing assignments were due on a SATURDAY night!! Crazy! She is also a subjective grader; her grading often makes no sense.

Professor Collingwood is an interesting character! Her online Women's Studies course is taught on Second Life. If you do the work and keep up w/ the readings you can easily get an A. Attendence is important, so if you don't like computers don't take this class -- lot's of work but not hard! I recommend it.

When it comes to French, she's an average professor--not too easy, not too difficult. She makes up games that are sometimes difficult to see the relevence to the text. Considering the material, she does a pretty decent job with what she's given. Be prepared for MANY red marks on exams, but the grades don't seem to reflect the amount of marks.

I agree...it is near impossible to get an A in her class...I recieved one 88% in her class and all my other grades were an 92% or better, with even a 98% on her midterm and I recieved a B+.  Trust me...its impossible to get an A.

I was deeply inspired and fascinated by Professor Collingwood. As an honors student, as well as a hard worker, I found the class to actually be quite easy-minimal memorization, easy papers and projects, and a clear note taking style. she wasn't great with a computer but she compensated by KNOWING her notes inside and out, unlike msot of my professo

I agree with the other review that the computer aspect makes things way more difficult than they'd need to be.. I hated the class when I was in it (only took it because I needed an honors course) because I did not agree with anything she taught.. Looking back though it's one of my favorite classes ever.  And yes, tons of work.

She is an interesting lady who deeply understands what she is teaching and the class lectures are always interesting and stimulating. However, if you take this class be prepared for a huge workload and a guaranteed B because no matter how hard you try on the assignments it's impossible to get higher than a 90.

summary_comment: Stacia is an excellent professor known for her clear expectations and challenging yet engaging teaching style, which ranges from introductory to advanced levels. Students appreciate her thorough explanations and ability to make complex material accessible, though her upper-level classes can be demanding. Overall, she is highly recommended for her fairness, dedication, and ability to maintain high academic standards while fostering an interesting learning environment.

Ratings.comment: I have had Stacia for classes from intro-level to advanced seminars and she is GREAT. She is very clear on what she expects you to know and challenges you to apply it critically. Her intro is a cinch, but don't let that fool you- her upper level classes kicked my butt. She loves to assign long readings as the level increases. Def take her, though.
Really hot. Really nice. Good prof to have.
She is a great teacher, it was her first time teaching the course and we had a lot of work. But other than that the class was interesting and engaging. I would take another class from her again!!!!

She is a great professor, she grades fair and wants her students to do well. There was a lot of material in the class but prudential that she is a great teacher, I would take another class she taught hands down!!!!
Hottest prof I've ever had.  Explained everything wonderfully well.  Kept the class difficult, but made the information easy to understand!  Oh, how I wish she were single!
Awesome teacher! Loved the class, nothing overly hard, but very interesting. Opportunity every class for extra credit.

summary_comment: Professor Tapia is highly regarded for her clarity and ability to maintain engaging discussions, making her courses both challenging and rewarding. Students appreciate her fairness, availability, and willingness to help, though some note that she expects significant effort, particularly in terms of reading and writing. Overall, she is seen as an excellent educator who fosters active participation and intellectual engagement.

Ratings.comment: This professor is really clear and keeps the topics interesting. If you can get her as your discussion leader too.

Professor Tapia engages her students at a high level, even though her course listings say otherwise. If you are looking for a challenging class, she is your lady. You will read a lot. You will write a lot. If you aren't willing to work, then don't waste your time. She is a very fair grader, availible and willing to help, and very easy on the eyes!

Professor Tapia is a fair and excellent teacher. She seems to be brilliant and is very knowledgeable in regards to the literature that is discussed. Participating in discussions is required, but as long as you engage somewhat, you will do fine (I got an A). Definitely an educational teacher and course.
Professor Tapia HAD PNEUMONIA and stayed in communication with students about all UNAVOIDABLE cancellations. this previous comment is entirely misleading.
Her class was very engaging and sometimes the class discussions were heated.  She did well to keep me interested even though I came into the class dreading every last second.

Great topic. Lots of reading! Not too good with responding to emails and other requests. Says she gives 100% effort on her behalf, it seemed more like 75% effort. Just a lot of reading and two good size papers. Very easy on the eyes.

Professor Tapia is a cool teacher. She's very intelligent and knows her stuff. She has great discussions and doesn't knock you for openly speaking your mind. She seems down to earth and isn't stuck up or stuck on herself like these other professors.
GREAT FOR DISCUSION
Class was cancelled 8 times in one quarter. N objectves of class were meet. Ten page paper due at end not relating to class at all.
Enjoyed her class very much.  Class load is very light.  Discussions were very interesting and she is an easy grader.  I would definitely recommend this professor.
best prof. i've had yet. she's awesome.
What an awesome teacher.  She actually made me love this class so much that I am doubling in Women Studies now.  Very clear lectures.  Always welcome to answer questions. Awesome prof
No question this woman is on her game.amazing lectures-lots of class discussion-totally flexible with students

summary_comment: Professor Dudley is highly knowledgeable and passionate about her subject, fostering engaging discussions and fair grading. However, she can be strict regarding attendance and communication, and her teaching style may not suit all students, particularly those who prefer less discussion and more traditional lectures. Overall, her classes are recommended for their depth and relevance, though students should be prepared for a rigorous and sometimes demanding environment.

Ratings.comment: Great prof. Taking her WGS 200 class at GVSU now. She knows what she is talking about. Although, she isn't very empathetic and takes a long time to respond to emails -- if she even gets to it. Other than that she is very strict at the beginning, but warms up as the class continues. She does take off 1/3 of a grade for every class missed.

Instructor Dudley is a funny, friendly teacher. The class is a lot of discussion, and she will make you talk if you are quiet. She grades fairly on the quizzes and assignments.  I enjoyed this class, and definitely her teaching method. I recommend taking this class.

Professor Dudley is very passionate about teaching and allows students to have a conversation that lasts a long time. It's not a hard class if you do the reading. There are 6 quizzes, two papers, and a midterm and a final. She grades fairly on everything, and definitely negotiates on almost everything. Take this class it's amazing!!!!

A good class to take. Instructor Dudley loves teaching women's studies!! She assigns a lot of reading BUT picks really interesting pieces so it's not bad. If you are a conservative (politically) you might reconsider unless you have a strong stomach. However, she does not push her opinions on you. No reason anyone cannot get an A with a little effor

summary_comment: Dr. Swenson is an excellent instructor known for her clear expectations and supportive approach. Students appreciate her fairness, friendliness, and the abundance of resources she provides. Her classes are generally easy with minimal required work, focusing on discussions, a few papers, and presentations. Overall, she is highly recommended for those seeking an accessible and engaging learning experience.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Swenson is a good instructor. She is very clear on what she wants out of her students from the beginning of the semester. She is a fair grader, but you have to read the material to do well. She doesn't make you buy any books, but she posts a lot of readings online for the class. Easy A if you try, and read the majority of what she gives you.

Dr. Swenson is fantastic. This class counts as a VPA GE and is super easy. One discussion board post a week doing a one paragraph analysis of a quote you pick from the reading, 2 exams (no time limits) and 2 projects. She is so friendly, communicative and helpful. She posts mini-lectures and tons of additional info on each weekly topic.
Haley is one of the best professors I've had at Ohio State! Her lectures are always well prepared and informative and she's just a fun professor in general. I definitely recommend!

Really easy class if you read the books. The class is just discussing what you read, writing a couple papers, and giving a presentation. Haley is really nice and an easy grader. Definitely recommend this class.

Really great class and a really great instructor. We watched pop culture media such as Futurama and Super Bad. Class discussions were really laid back and everyone was free to say anything they wanted. Midterm involved an essay and a test. Final involved a multimedia analysis of advertising and a test. Highly recommended course.

summary_comment: This professor excels in teaching, consistently engaging students in lively and enjoyable class discussions that enhance the learning experience.

Ratings.comment: She truly loves teaching and makes class discussions interesting, as well as fun.

summary_comment: Ally is an exceptionally knowledgeable and passionate professor who significantly enhances students' understanding of the subject matter, particularly in Women's Health. Her classes are rigorous and demanding, requiring extensive reading and critical engagement, but students find them rewarding and often highly recommend them. While her grading can be challenging, especially for papers, she is supportive and encourages active participation.

Ratings.comment: I really enjoyed the material in this class, but it is a ton of work! I put more work and effort into this class than all my other classes combined. She is a tough grader on papers, and I never had a problem writing papers before until this class. The class is demanding; I suggest taking it when you have a lighter load.

Love the material, but there is a lot of it! I put more work and effort into this class than any of my others, but yet my grades are better in my other courses. She is a very tough grader on papers and I've never had any real issues paper writing until I took this class. I've learned a lot but this class is an enter at your own risk!

I learned more in Ally's Women's Health class than I probably have in 4 years of college. Not only does she explain things clearly, but she does so in a manner that is unbiased and extremely educated. I highly recommend this class to ALL students!!!!
Ally is awesome! She is so helpful with the papers, and the reading is very interesting. I loved her class, and I wasn't even interested in Women's Studies before!
Ally was a great prof very interested in helping students understand and grasp the material. She's awesome :)

First of all, make sure you READ everything, it will help you on your papers. She grades kind of rough on the papers so make sure you meet with her to come up with an outline. Make sure you come to class because she has Critical Responses and you never know when those will be.  Take this class if you like reading, because there is A LOT involved.

Pretty alright, passionate, humorous. Negative: Looking for a very SPECIFIC writing style/approach to the paper prompts. Not much room on the grading scale, but I suppose it's good 'training'. Didn't explain thoroughly 'feminist analysis' until 4 weeks left in AU quarter [required in all papers] Be weary, read & go to office hours to bother her.

I can't remember the section number, but it was a Lit class.  She is wonderful to work with and always encourages participation and thinking outside the box.  Super helpful and wants people to voice their opinions.  I highly recommend her!
Very nice professor but often times demanding. Take at your own risk. Fair grader but have somethings to improve on.

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods and engaging content, making the class both accessible and enjoyable. She provides all necessary materials online, ensuring students are well-prepared for exams, and offers a mix of multimedia resources to enhance learning. While the class is manageable, regular attendance is crucial due to occasional pop quizzes.

Ratings.comment: WGSST 230-Race, Gender and Sexuality in Popular Culture for a visual arts credit. No textbook, but she gives you readings through Carmen. Read them, understad them, show up to class, and youll be fine. There are 2 blog assignments, a midterm, a final, and 5 quizzes. Shes nice, and the class is interesting! Take this if you have no artistic talent.

This class was very easy. She post the notes and whatevers on them is on the exam. Lots of great videos, songs and movies to complement the course topics. She has pop quizzes though so go to class. she drops the lowest one.... Very recommended!

summary_comment: The professor effectively engages students with interesting discussions, albeit from a feminist perspective, and is known for being approachable and easy to work with. Her lectures are pertinent, and she does not require a textbook, instead providing relevant assignments and exams. The class is generally considered easy, though some find the material challenging due to the required viewings.

Ratings.comment: For a grad student, she did a pretty good job. Discussions were interesting, if perhaps from a slightly biased feminist perspective. She was approachable and easy to work with. Gave pertinent lectures, did not require a textbook, and had pertinent assignments and exams.

This class is insanely easy, but the syllabus doesn't tell you it's a really hard class. its women in film in hollywood, it shouldnt be hard.  The hardest thing about this class is watching imitation of life
I took this class for my film GEC, and if you still need to fulfill that, I defintley recommend taking this course. It's super easy, and we watched good movies like Silence of the Lambs and Clueless.

summary_comment: The professor is generally regarded as effective and supportive, known for being flexible with due dates and clear in her lectures, which can lead to good grades with minimal effort. However, some students find her lectures dense and biased, with a perceived favoritism towards majors and a strong feminist perspective that some find off-putting. Overall, while many appreciate her help and desire for student success, there are concerns about the relevance of the material and the teaching style.

Ratings.comment: Great Teacher, flexible due dates, extremely helpful, just wants to see everyone learn and pass...

A book a week is ridiculous. She didn't like having opinions that did not concur with hers. She's biased towards students who are majors in the WS dept. Lots of unhappy students when it was time for evaluations.
good teacher. clear lectures. easy to get a good grade if you do a little bit of work. flexible with due dates.
Very engaging professor. Tests hard, but she tries to prepare you for them. Definitely more of a feminist than a professor though.

is more of a feminist than a teacher.  lecture slides were a little wordy, and discussions surrounding the readings were not helpful in aiding students to grasp concepts.  only twice did we sit in a circle in class and discuss the readings, which were the two readings that i ended up retaining the most from.
Covered a lot of information that seemed unnecessary considering this was everyone's first women's studies course.

Christy is really very helpful, and wants students to do well. She is concise and willing to explain ideas, or discuss things not necessarily covered in class. Reading is important for this class, but she doesn't get too angry if you don't do it. I definitely recommend her as a teacher.

summary_comment: The professor is generally well-regarded for her insightfulness and ability to encourage deeper exploration of the subject matter, particularly in nursing. However, her lectures often fall short in engaging students and facilitating class discussions, and she tends to rely heavily on readings without incorporating other media. Students appreciate her helpfulness and approachability but also note issues with excessive reading and unclear grading.

Ratings.comment: She was a nice professor, but I was usually disappointed in the lectures. I don't doubt her knowledge, but shes needs to find a way to lead better class discussions and help students engage with the material. Almost all the class material was taught exclusively through readings, I wish she had tried to incorporate other types of media to analyze.

I love Dr. Bernhard. She is so helpful and approachable. She generates great discussions and is open to many different points of view. The way she taught 300 was not difficult. Do the readings and assignments and participate in the class and you'll do fine! Take her class!
Way too much reading and unclear grading. Nice lady though.
She was insightful and encouraged students to explore deeper aspects of nursing than most classes.

Only a 3 hour credit class had too much work involved. She thought she knew all about the subject when she was actually clueless. Class could have been taught in 1 hr but she would stretch it on to 3 hrs. So boring and she would never take any of our comments from past classes to improve her teaching style.

summary_comment: Lindsay is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, noted for her availability and willingness to assist students, making her classes highly recommended. Her approach has particularly transformed students' perceptions, with many finding value in what was initially perceived as a niche subject.

Ratings.comment: Though I've only been in the class for a few weeks, I highly recommend taking 101 with Lindsay.  She's extremely helpful and willing to make time for us to meet with her.  I was hesitant to take a woman's studies course, but I am loving this one.

summary_comment: Tracey is highly regarded for her effective teaching and supportive demeanor. While her class is considered easy due to its 100-level status, students appreciate the quality of learning and her openness to diverse ideas. She is praised for her kindness and willingness to assist, making her a strong recommendation for students.

Ratings.comment: Loved Tracey! Class was easy, but rightfully so, since it was 100-level. Learned a lot too. Tracey isn't the dtereotypical "feminist" and is open to other people's ideas, and doesn't judge. She is so nice and willing to help anyone who needs it. Highly recommend taking her!

summary_comment: The professor is knowledgeable in writing skills and techniques but struggles with clear instructions and fairness, often playing favorites. Students found her generally friendly and helpful, with mixed opinions on the relevance and clarity of assignments, though many noted improvements in their writing. However, several students criticized her vagueness, unprofessionalism, and heavy reliance on subjective grading.

Ratings.comment: She is not very clear on her instructions and does play favorites. Very knowledgeable in writing skills and techniques.

While, admittedly, some of her assignments were quite vague, she was more than willing to help with any problems or confusion.   I thought her grading was fair and she would always provide adequate feedback on what we wrote.  I thought she was quite friendly and a rather decent teacher.

First of all, our class was supposed to be a computer oriented English class. Other people I know in English 110C01 were making Photoshop images, mixed audio files, iMovies, etc. We on the otherhand only got to use those fun programs for our final project which was just about the most confusing prompt for an assignment that I have ever seen.

Quite possibly the most vague, confusing, and unprofessional teacher I have ever had.  I was under the impression that this was a college course, but the elementary assignments (busy work:  not only have I not learned anything, but I'm confident that my intelligence level has been jeopardized being in this class) that we had to do were rediculous.

The class started out kind of wierd but I ended up really liking it though.  My writing got a lot better and the readings were mostly pretty interesting but she really spent a lot of time on class stuff.  She talks a lot but she knows what she's talking about.  And she's hot.

She plays favorites big time, so DO NOT take her, there is no way to get an A if you are a good writer alone, you have to be liked by her.  She also makes you research everything that will help her with her graduate degree and its really annoying.  Don't do it.

Wendy is actually a TA. She's a really nice woman and very hot but she is a HORRIBLE teacher.  She's a very hard grader and definitely plays favorites.  The homework is a bit too much but you will read some excellent literature.

summary_comment: Anne Mitchell's class is generally considered easy with a focus on reading and frequent, easy quizzes. However, the amount of reading required can be substantial and often boring, and students must thoroughly understand the material to perform well. Overall, while some find the class engaging and enjoyable, others find it demanding and pointlessly busy.

Ratings.comment: Easy class. Ready level is kind of high, but its easy stuff to read. She gives random quizzes that are extremely easy if you read. No exams, just papers. Class was okay, kind of pointless but attendance is part of your grade

I loved this class.  Anne Mitchell kept me interested in learning more about the topics we discussed.  She is a fun and exciting teacher and has a sense of humor which is always fun. You do A LOT of reading, however the readings are somewhat interesting. Be prepared for pop quizes too! Other than that I love her teaching and her class was easy!

I didn't like this course at all.  It wasn't extremely hard, it's just that you had to do so much reading and the quizzes where pretty hard if you didn't read and understand the assigned readings. I failed 3 out of 4 quizzes and still got a B, but that's because she assigns papers and they are worth 40 and 50 pts. Read and study for pop quizzes.

You have to read a lot!! No time for anything else and you have to know every detail of the reading to pass the quizzes. Readings are very boring and movies are the same. I got an A- because I read everything and studied hard for exams. I even failed two quizzes. She does not compromise

summary_comment: Cricket is an exceptional professor who consistently inspires class discussions and engagement with the material. She caters to individual student interests and fosters a democratic classroom environment where students have significant input. Her teaching style, which includes circle discussions, role-plays, and other interactive methods, creates a close-knit and dynamic learning atmosphere.

Ratings.comment: Cricket is one of my favorite prof's ever (I'm graduating this quarter so I've had a lot). She inspires class discussion and participation, engages students  well with the material and is always willing to cater to individual interests and provide assistance. Take her class!!

Amazing professor, probably one of the best in the Women's Studies dept. She makes the classroom a democracy, so students tell her how much time they want to write papers or how they want to conduct class. Course material is challenging (in a good way).

Cricket is very friendly, and extremely engaging. She's a big fan of 'circle' discussion, and does more leading of a discussion than actually lecturing, which is awesome. She also does role-play and things like that to help students understand, and to foster a closeness within the classroom.

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for her engaging and humorous teaching style, which facilitated significant learning among students. However, some students felt that the material was straightforward and easily mastered through reading, perceiving the instructor as occasionally incorrect and the exams as overly simplistic. Overall, the course appears to offer an easy path to a good grade.

Ratings.comment: She was cool, nice, funny and I learned a lot!

I often felt like I knew more than her about the nuances of her subject. A few times during the quarter I thought she was just plain wrong. The tests are really easy as long as you do the reading. It's a pretty easy A.

summary_comment: Melanie is widely regarded as one of the best professors at OSU, known for her engaging and fun lectures that cover interesting topics and include enjoyable readings. While some students found the class to be more accessible than a typical college-level course, many praised her approachability, knowledge, and ability to make the material engaging. Overall, her classes are highly recommended for those looking for a GEC credit or simply an enjoyable learning experience.

Ratings.comment: Her friends definitely put all those super great comments. I actually took the class because of them and was awfully disappointed. She's nice but the class should hardly be considered a college level class.
Easy but boring and not interesting. Talked about celebs, looked at pictures, watched tv clips. Useless but a definitely a GPA upper.
She is a terrific teacher, it is obvious she loves pop culture and women studies. If you need a GEC course this is the best I have taken at OSU, very easy but you learn a lot in the process.

Melanie is awesome and so is this class. She's open-minded, approachable, helpful, and makes class and assignments fun. You can tell she really enjoys teaching her subject. And I agree, she is cute! Take this class- you'll be glad you did!
Melanie is actually one of the best professors at OSU... her lectures are interesting and attending class was fun. Topics are awesome and the readings are enjoyable. TAKE HER CLASS.

What a fantastic class. One of the gems of the OSU GEC course list. Melanie is awesome and knowledgable. Always willing to help. And she's TOTALLY gorgeous so...you will have motivation to go to an already fascinating class.
Melanie is awesome - lecture is mandatory but its always interesting and fun.  Tests aren't difficult if you pay attention - I didn't read but I imagine most would find it beneficial.

summary_comment: This professor offers an easy class with minimal assignments that are graded leniently. Students must read from the text and participate in discussions, though the latter can be loosely related to the material. Exams are straightforward, with provided study guides, making the course accessible overall.

Ratings.comment: Her class is pretty easy. There's about 5 easy papers you have to do, but she grades easy. You do have to read a lot from the text, because you discuss what you read, and participation is a big part of your grade. But the discussion goes so off track you can bs a lot of what you say.  Exams are simple and she gives you study guides. Take the class.

summary_comment: Katie is widely regarded as the top English instructor at OSU, known for her dedication to student success and engaging teaching style. Students appreciate her willingness to go above and beyond to help them understand and enjoy the material, finding her assignments both challenging and rewarding. Her class, 367.01, is highly recommended.

Ratings.comment: Best English teacher I have ever had. PERIOD.

Katie is by far the best teacher I have had at OSU. She is willing to do whatever it takes to help her students succeed. Class was always entertaining and the novels she assigned were actually enjoyable to read. Her assignments are a tad challenging, but if you go to class and read the novels, you will be fine. Definitely take this class, 367.01!

summary_comment: Katie is widely regarded as one of the top teachers due to her deep passion for her subject and her commitment to student success. She effectively engages students in dynamic discussions, making the ever-changing field of WGSS accessible and intriguing. Her comprehensive knowledge allows her to address any question students might have, fostering a supportive and enriching learning environment.

Ratings.comment: Katie is probably the best teacher I've had so far here. She really cares about what she's teaching and she wants her students to be successful. Because WGSS is an ever-changing subject, she makes everything discussion based and she can answer literally any question you have. I was skeptical to take this class, but she made me love it.

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for her effective and engaging teaching methods, making the class interactive and accessible even in an online format. Students praise her passion for the subject matter and her dedication to fostering a supportive learning environment. Her approachable nature and willingness to connect personal experiences with course content have significantly enhanced students' interest and understanding of women's studies.

Ratings.comment: She was amazing! Even as an online class, I felt like she really tried to get to know us. I learned a lot. There was a lot of reading each week and then everyone would participate in an online discussion. As long as you gave your responses before the due date, you would get 100%. She was an easy grader for the midterm paper and final paper.

Professor Stonebrook made the class very interactive. Her teaching style was great and she is very considerate to students. Even though the class says "women studies" she broke the shyness in class by her great teaching skills. I highly recommend taking her class, especially for men. This class will make you learn great things!

Rachel was by far the best instructor I've encountered in my 4 years.  She is extremely passionate about her work and really cares about sparking the students' minds. She's the very reason I'm so interested in many of the topics that are now dear to me. She's very open about her personal life and makes great connections to outside of the class.
Very helpful and passionate about the class. She has a fun personality and provides a good foundation of basic concerns of Women's Studies.
